sentences.english: The new premier is forming his government mainly from young men.
sentences.chinese: 這位新總理主要從年輕人中物色人選組建政府。

sentences.english: It really is the best nominee who connects this club.
sentences.chinese: 實在是接這一棒子的最佳人選。

sentences.english: So I told her that Disciple Stanley would be the suitable person to do it.
sentences.chinese: 因此我告訴她弟子成穗是譯此文的合適人選。

sentences.english: And I began the search for a vice-presidential nominee.
sentences.chinese: 同時我也開始尋找副總統的人選。

sentences.english: Back off - pushy persistence will not get you to first base.
sentences.chinese: 後退一步，堅持不一定讓你成爲第一人選。

sentences.english: Once we found an appropriate person, we will close the message at once.
sentences.chinese: 一旦我們找到合適的人選，我們會即刻關閉此帖。

sentences.english: Well, I think Christine Lagarde was the best person for the job.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我認爲拉加德女士是該職位的最佳人選。

sentences.english: I don't see many other world class left-backs available.
sentences.chinese: 我想不到比他更適合這個位置的世界級左後衛人選。

sentences.english: Mo is a deserving candidate and hopefully he'll get consideration.
sentences.chinese: 小莫是一個很不錯的人選，我希望他會考慮。

sentences.english: Do you think she's the proper lady-in-waiting for a queen?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲她是陪同王后的合適人選嗎？

sentences.english: Some people take dates to the megaplex. Other people go with friends.
sentences.chinese: 有些人選在影城約會，有些人則和朋友一起去看電影。

sentences.english: Strauss-Kahn was once considered a frontrunner for the French presidential nomination.
sentences.chinese: 卡恩曾被認爲是法國總統提名人選的領跑者。

sentences.english: The male lead, still uncast, will not warble.
sentences.chinese: 男主角還沒有確定的人選。

sentences.english: Don Quixote was sure that he was the right man to be a knight -errant.
sentences.chinese: 唐吉訶德確信自己就是成爲遊俠的適當人選。

sentences.english: The Church Board shall consult all Ministry Committees regarding the recommended candidate.
sentences.chinese: 教會執事會必須與所有堂務委員會洽商經推薦的人選。

sentences.english: The right man for the job needs to be enthusiastic and energetic.
sentences.chinese: 這份工作的適合人選應該是滿腔熱情而且精力充沛的。

definition: to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to take part in an election/to run for office
to promote to a higher position
